attributes.action: Sign the Council of Europe convention on Action against Trafficking in Human Beings
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
CONVENTION ON ACTION AGAINST TRAFFICKING 
IN HUMAN BEINGS 
We call upon the UK Government to sign and ratify without delay The Council of Europe’s Convention on Action Against Trafficking in Human Beings
It is the only international law that provides trafficked people with guaranteed minimum standards of protection. We are particularly concerned about women and men trafficked into virtual slavery in the sex trade.
We are concerned that Britain shall mark this bicentenary by signing the Council of Europe Convention on Action against Trafficking in Human Beings. We note that 34 countries have already signed this Convention. It will be an important opportunity for the government to show that it is still committed to the abolition of slavery.
 We understand that a Statutory Order is contemplated to bring it into force. We hope that this Statutory Order will be subjected to sufficiently rigorous Parliamentary scrutiny.
